channel.title: Physics on Diptanuj Sarkar
channel.description: Recent content in Physics on Diptanuj Sarkar

item.title: Interesting Physics Links
item.description: Some interesting links from around the internet
item.content:encoded:
I plan on collecting all the cool sites that I find, related to Physics of course, here.

  • K. McDonald’s Physics Examples: A rich, old-internet site with myriad resources pertaining to physics.
  • PSE: Book Recommendations: Physics StackExhange’s very own list of recommended books and resources.
  • In The Dark: Cute Problems: A very nice little blog with some nice questions.
  • Tong Lectures: The David Tong lecture notes.
  • Wolfram ScienceWorld: A cool website with a lot of historical information.
  • UCSD Quantum Mechanics Notes: Equation heavy, but thorough Quantum Mechanics notes.
  • MIT OCW Physics: Of course

item.title: Some Mathematical Methods notes for QM
item.description: Source: Principles of Quantum Mechanics, Shankar
item.content:encoded: Here are some handwritten notes that I took while working through chapter 1 of Shankar’s Principles of Quantum Mechanics. Hope this is of use.
